chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
X: Type
P: code

Goal:
P <sc P

Premises:
subcode_cons_inj : forall (i : nat) (ρ δ : X) P, (i, ρ :: nil) <sc P -> (i, δ :: nil) <sc P -> ρ = δ
subcode_length : forall P (Q : nat * list X), P <sc Q -> code_start Q <= code_start P /\ code_end P <= code_end Q
subcode_start_in_code : forall P (Q : nat * list X), 0 < code_length P -> P <sc Q -> in_code (code_start P) Q
subcode_length' : forall P (Q : nat * list X), P <sc Q -> length (snd P) <= length (snd Q)
subcode_length_le : forall P (Q : nat * list X), P <sc Q -> fst Q <= fst P /\ fst P + length (snd P) <= fst Q + length (snd Q)
Inductive sigT (A : Type) (P : A -> Type) : Type := existT : forall x : A, P x -> {x : A & P x} Arguments sigT [A]%type_scope _%type_scope Arguments existT [A]%type_scope _%function_scope
Inductive sig (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) : Type := exist : forall x : A, P x -> {x : A | P x} Arguments sig [A]%type_scope _%type_scope Arguments exist [A]%type_scope _%function_scope
ZifyClasses.rew_iff : forall P Q : Prop, P < -> Q -> P -> Q
Tauto.BFormula = fun A : Type => Tauto.GFormula : Type -> Type Arguments Tauto.BFormula _%type_scope
Relation_Definitions.relation = fun A : Type => A -> A -> Prop : Type -> Type Arguments Relation_Definitions.relation _%type_scope
in_code = fun (i : nat) P => code_start P <= i < code_end P : nat -> code -> Prop Arguments in_code _%nat_scope _ /
out_code = fun (i : nat) P => i < code_start P \/ code_end P <= i : nat -> code -> Prop Arguments out_code _%nat_scope _ /
code_start = fun P => fst P : code -> nat Arguments code_start _ /
in_out_code : forall (i : nat) P, in_code i P -> out_code i P -> False
Relation_Operators.clos_refl_sym_trans_ind : forall (A : Type) (R : Relation_Definitions.relation A) (P : A -> A -> Prop), (forall x y : A, R x y -> P x y) -> (forall x : A, P x x) -> (forall x y : A, Relation_Operators.clos_refl_sym_trans A R x y -> P x y -> P y x) -> (forall x y z : A, Relation_Operators.clos_refl_sym_trans A R x y -> P x y -> Relation_Operators.clos_refl_sym_trans A R y z -> P y z -> P x z) -> forall a a0 : A, Relation_Operators.clos_refl_sym_trans A R a a0 -> P a a0
code_end = fun P => fst P + length (snd P) : code -> nat Arguments code_end _ /
exist : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (x : A), P x -> {x : A | P x}
existT : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Type) (x : A), P x -> {x : A & P x}
measure_rect : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> nat) (P : X -> Type), (forall x : X, (forall y : X, m y < m x -> P y) -> P x) -> forall x : X, P x
code = (nat * list X)%type : Type
code_length = fun P => length (snd P) : code -> nat Arguments code_length _ /
subcode = fun P (Q : nat * list X) => let (i, li) := P in let (n, code) := Q in exists l r : list X, code = l ++ li ++ r /\ i = n + length l : code -> nat * list X -> Prop Arguments subcode _ _ /
Inductive prod (A B : Type) : Type := pair : A -> B -> A * B Arguments prod (_ _)%type_scope Arguments pair {A B}%type_scope
Variant qualifier (q : nat) (T : Type) : Type := Qualifier : ssrbool.pred_sort (ssrbool.predPredType T) -> ssrbool.qualifier q T Arguments ssrbool.qualifier _%nat_scope _%type_scope Arguments ssrbool.Qualifier _%nat_scope [T]%type_scope
Record Formula (T : Type) : Type := Build_Formula { Flhs : EnvRing.PExpr T; Fop : RingMicromega.Op2; Frhs : EnvRing.PExpr T } Arguments RingMicromega.Formula _%type_scope Arguments RingMicromega.Build_Formula [T]%type_scope
Inductive option (A : Type) : Type := Some : A -> option A | None : option A Arguments option _%type_scope Arguments Some {A}%type_scope a : rename Arguments None {A}%type_scope
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
Inductive t (A : Type) : Type := Empty : VarMap.t A | Elt : A -> VarMap.t A | Branch : VarMap.t A -> A -> VarMap.t A -> VarMap.t A Arguments VarMap.t _%type_scope Arguments VarMap.Empty {A}%type_scope Arguments VarMap.Elt {A}%type_scope Arguments VarMap.Branch {A}%type_scope
Inductive ZArithProof : Type := DoneProof : ZMicromega.ZArithProof | RatProof : ZMicromega.ZWitness -> ZMicromega.ZArithProof -> ZMicromega.ZArithProof | CutProof : ZMicromega.ZWitness -> ZMicromega.ZArithProof -> ZMicromega.ZArithProof | EnumProof : ZMicromega.ZWitness -> ZMicromega.ZWitness -> list ZMicromega.ZArithProof -> ZMicromega.ZArithProof | ExProof : BinNums.positive -> ZMicromega.ZArithProof -> ZMicromega.ZArithProof Arguments ZMicromega.EnumProof _ _ _%list_scope Arguments ZMicromega.ExProof _%positive_scope
Inductive Pol (C : Type) : Type := Pc : C -> EnvRing.Pol C | Pinj : BinNums.positive -> EnvRing.Pol C -> EnvRing.Pol C | PX : EnvRing.Pol C -> BinNums.positive -> EnvRing.Pol C -> EnvRing.Pol C Arguments EnvRing.Pol _%type_scope Arguments EnvRing.Pc {C}%type_scope Arguments EnvRing.Pinj {C}%type_scope _%positive_scope Arguments EnvRing.PX {C}%type_scope _ _%positive_scope
